entry.title: The shortest writing tutorial in the world

link.title: The shortest writing tutorial in the world

entry.content:
Tutorial 1.

Beginnings;

  1. Sharing is good
  2. All first drafts are shit
  3. If you are not writing then read - doing one makes you better at the other
  4. It’s all in the editing so just get it written then get it right
  5. It’s not about being good it’s knowing how to improve
  6. Write every day, something, anything … that’s what writers do

entry.title: Tech tips for writers
entry.content:
There's not much here yet on the tech front - however I plan on producing a series of short blogs to help writers in particular reflect on their workflow and how it can be assisted and hindered by IT.

I've been impressed with Ghost and am using a free version of a Ghost-like layout for this site which is generated by Jekyll and hosted on github for free.

I use Tinderbox from Eastgate to organise my thinking and generate the site which I tweak with VS-Code before a git push to Github

It's been fun and feels a little like the web of yester-year when everything was ad-free, collegiate and free! - there will be no ads here ever so please do subscribe to get the pearls of wisdom when they eventually fall from my increasingly sedentary pen.
